title: Boy Scout rescued from Mount Washington after allergic reaction
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A 15-year-old Boy Scout from Connecticut had a significant allergic reaction near the summit of Mount Washington.
New Hampshire Fish and Game received an alert at 1 p.m. and managed a successful rescue operation by 3 p.m.
The teen was transported by Snowcat to an ambulance and then taken to Androscoggin Valley Hospital for treatment.

title: New owner steps in at Grumpy’s
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Thomas Holmes, 28, has purchased Grumpy's, a breakfast spot in East Dennis, without plans to change staffing, menu, or decor.
Holmes acquired Grumpy's at the end of January; the property remains with previous owner Jim Manning.
Holmes aims to maintain Grumpy's legacy as an iconic diner, while he continues his role in the tech sector.

title: Local obituary: John Rousanidis, Peabody 33-year-old and crewmember on Lily Jean
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: John Rousanidis, 33, from Peabody, died on January 30, 2026, while working on the fishing vessel Lily Jean.
John was born in Salem, raised in Peabody, and moved to Greece at age 8, where he developed his love for the sea.
A memorial service for John Rousanidis will be held at St. Vasilios Greek Orthodox Church in Peabody on February 20, 2026.

title: What experts are saying about a possible Patriots trade for Maxx Crosby
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The Patriots are considering trading for Raiders' defensive end Maxx Crosby to strengthen their pass-rush capabilities.
Maxx Crosby, with 69.5 sacks over seven NFL seasons, has expressed interest in playing under Patriots coach Mike Vrabel.
Financial flexibility from rookie quarterback Drake Maye’s contract increases the feasibility of acquiring Crosby for the Patriots.

title: Local obituary: Sgt. Freeman Short, 31-year-old Marshfield native and Lily Jean crewmember
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Sgt. Freeman Locklin Short, a Marshfield native, was lost at sea as a crewmember of F/V Lily Jean on January 30, 2026.
Freeman graduated from Presque Isle High School in 2013 and earned a Bachelor's Degree in Financial Economics from the University of Maine in 2018.
He served in the Maine Army National Guard and is survived by his parents, three siblings, and girlfriend Tiffany Leigh.

title: Police seek suspect in $15K purse theft
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Worcester Police seek help identifying suspect in $15,000 purse theft from Sweet Jane’s Designer Consignment.
Surveillance photos show suspect with stolen items and a vehicle linked to the incident.
Tips can be submitted to Worcester Police by phone at 509-799-8651 or text to 9274637.

title: Push for more housing in Union Square hinges on zoning change
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: The Hamilton Company filed a zoning amendment to build a 180-unit development at Somerville Avenue and Prospect Street.
The development includes two six-story buildings with retail, commercial, and civic uses on the ground floor.
Somerville City Council must approve the zoning change to allow housing in the current commercial zone.

title: Hanover, Mass. woman killed while sunbathing in Florida is identified
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Anastasia Fiona Ullman, 65, was killed by a Jeep while sunbathing in Fort Pierce, Florida on February 7.
Ullman was an active Hanover, Mass. resident, involved in the South Weymouth Church and the Council on Aging.
She was in Florida caring for her mother at the time; Ullman is survived by her two children and partner.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the ‘super active’ weather pattern ahead
author: John Waller
bullets: Boston expects an active weather pattern with rain turning to snow Wednesday, affecting roads after dark.
Meteorologists predict 1-3 inches of snow in different areas, with higher elevations seeing over 3 inches.
Unsettled weather continues into next week, with potential snow and rain mix on Friday and a coastal storm Monday.

title: Tiffani Faison opens new restaurant Tigerbaby at High Street Place
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Tiffani Faison opened her new restaurant Tigerbaby at High Street Place in downtown Boston on February 17, 2026.
Tigerbaby serves Asian cuisine, inspired by the former Tiger Mama restaurant, with dishes like Thai basil chicken and tangerine chicken.
Tigerbaby is the fifth establishment from Faison's Big Heart Hospitality at High Street Place, focusing on quick, carry-out options.
